R0075.title: Critical Information Infrastructure (CII) Compliance Risk
R0075.definition: Compliance risk in the critical information infrastructure domain refers to the risk that an organization fails to meet relevant regulations and address potential threats in the CII sector.
R0075.description: Scenarios include failure to ensure the security of networks and information systems, non-compliance with national and regional information security regulations, and failure to respond to cyberattacks and data breaches.
R0075.influence: May lead to legal sanctions, service disruptions, information leakage, and public safety risks.
